ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This is a great course if one is interested in applying phylogenetic methods in their research.
It was relatively helpful, but I feel like I could have found most of the tutorials on the internet and done them on my own time; I didn't necessarily need to have a lab to learn to do it.
A great class for those who are interested in creating phylogenies for their research.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I gained hands-on experience with data preparation and software for building and interpreting phylogenetic trees.

What I learned was very helpful, because I'll probably keep using at least some of these tools. However, I am not sure that I needed a lab in which to learn them.I do think that having a final paper and a final exam (even if the exam for the lab got canceled a few days before it was supposed to take place) for both the class and the lab was a bit overwhelming, especially when we didn't get any feedback on our topics (which is basically just a recipe for procrastinating as long as possible). It would have been nice to have, say, homeworks for the lab section and a final paper for the class, but not two final papers and two exams.
Extremely applicable for my dissertation as well as everyone else in the class.
